content.text: Angelica goes to watch a football match
She entered the stadium at 19 20 and left at 22 05
Work out the number of hours and minutes she was in the stadium
The number of people watching the football match was 25 926
Write 25 926 correct to the nearest thousand
The football club buys lemonade in 5 litre bottles
Work out the number of 250 millilitre drinks that can be poured from one bottle
Draw a bar chart to show this information
Complete the scale on the frequency axis
The table shows the number of goals scored in each match by Mathsletico Rangers
Work out the time taken to travel from home to the airport
Give your answer in hours and minutes
Calculate Helva's average speed for the whole journey from home to the airport
Between which two times was Helva travelling fastest?
Helva's husband left their home at 11 00 and travelled directly to the airport
The travel graph shows Helva's journey from her home to the airport
Helva and her husband are flying from Finland to India
Their plane takes off at 17 00 and arrives in India 7 hours 25 minutes later
The time in India is \(3 \frac{1}{2}\) hours ahead of the time in Finland
What is the local time in India when the plane arrives?
The temperature is \(- 3^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\) in Finland and \(23^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\) in India
Write down the difference between these two temperatures
How many euros did Helva receive?
Give your answer correct to 2 decimal places
She gives \(\frac{2}{5}\) of the money to her son
Work out how much her son receives
Mrs Ali gives $2400 to her grandchildren Elize, Sam and Juan in the ratio
Calculate how much they each receive
Mrs Ali invests $200 000 for 3 years at a rate of \(4\%\) per year compound interest
Calculate the total amount of money she will have at the end of the 3 years
Give your answer correct to the nearest dollar
Mrs Ali spends a total of \(\)9000\(on the following items
Mrs Ali sold her house for \(600 000
What special type of quadrilateral is shape \(A\) ?
Describe fully the **single** transformation which maps shape \(A\) onto shape \(B\)
reflect shape \(A\) in the \(y\)-axis and label the image \(C\),
translate shape \(A\) by \(\begin{pmatrix} - 6 \\ - 4 \end{pmatrix}\) and label the image \(D\),
enlarge shape \(A\) by scale factor 2, with centre (0, 0) and label the image \(E\)
Write down the next two terms of this sequence
Write down the rule for finding the next term of this sequence
Find an expression for the \(n\)th term of this sequence
These are the first four terms of a sequence
The \(n\)th term of another sequence is \(2n + 6\)
Write down the first three terms of this sequence
The first three diagrams of a different sequence are shown below
The points \(F, G, H\) and \(I\) lie on a circle, centre \(C\)
\(FG\) is a diameter and \(DE\) is a tangent to the circle at \(I\)
A ladder, \(GH,\) of length \(6\mathrm{m},\) leans against the house wall
The foot of the ladder is \(2\mathrm{m}\) from this wall
This diagram shows the plan of the driveway to the house
Work out the perimeter of the driveway
The driveway is made from concrete
Calculate the volume of concrete used for the driveway
Give your answer in cubic metres
The diagram shows a house, built on level ground
Complete the table of values for \(y = x^{2} + 2x - 4\)
On the grid, draw the graph of \(y = x^{2} + 2x - 4\) for \(-4 \leqslant x \leqslant 3\)
Draw the line of symmetry on the graph
Write down the equation of this line of symmetry
Use your graph to solve the equation \(x^{2} + 2x - 4 = 3\)
Find the distance in kilometres from \(A\) to \(B\)
Town \(D\) is \(9\mathrm{km}\) from \(A\) on a bearing of \(135^{\circ}\)
Mark the position of town \(D\) on the diagram
The diagram shows the positions of three towns \(A, B\) and \(C\)
Write this number in standard form
Which town, \(C\) or \(D\), has the larger population and by how much?
Give your answer in standard form
